newsitem.title: USA: Grant names Larry Lenig president/COO.
newsitem.headline: Grant names Larry Lenig president/COO.

text.p: Grant Geophysical Tuesday said Larry Lenig Jr has been appointed president and chief operating officer of the company.

Lenig replaces former president Thomas Portwood, who replaced George Tilley in the position last November. Grant also named Michael Keirnan vice president and chief financial officer, replacing William Cleveland.
Grant further announced that it has reached an agreement in principle to sell its Nigerian subsidiary to a group of investors based in the United Kingdom.

The agreement, which is subject to Bankruptcy Court approval, provides for the purchaser to pay to Grant certain consideration in cash or letter of credit backed notes and to assume or obtain releases of all obligations of Grant which relate to its previous operations in Nigeria.
Grant anticipates that the sale will not result in the recording of any material gain or loss.
In each of 1994 and 1995, the company's Nigerian operations recorded gross revenues of approximately $15 million. In 1996, the company's Nigerian sourced revenues were less than $1 million.
